word_mean: 随意肌的非随意性收缩发作，伴有寒冷感及皮肤苍白

sentence.Network_cn: 针对学生的暴力使得整个印度尼西亚不寒而栗。

sentence.Network_en: Wool traps your body heat, keeping the chill at bay.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English cele, ciele 'cold, coldness', of Germanic origin; related to cold

entry.def: When you chill something or when it chills, you lower its temperature so that it becomes colder but does not freeze.

example.ex: Chill the fruit salad until serving time...
example.tran: 把水果色拉冰镇一下，吃的时候再拿出来。

example.ex: These doughs can be rolled out while you wait for the pastry to chill.
example.tran: 在等油酥糕饼凉的时候，可以把这些面团擀薄些。

entry.def: When cold weather or something cold chills a person or a place, it makes that person or that place feel very cold.

example.ex: The marble floor was beginning to chill me...
example.tran: 大理石地面开始让我觉得发冷。

example.ex: An exposed garden may be chilled by cold winds...
example.tran: 露天花园容易被冷风吹透。

entry.def: If you say that something you see, hear, or feel chills you, you mean that it frightens you.

example.ex: There was a coldness in her that chilled him...
example.tran: 她身上透着一股冷漠，让他不寒而栗。

example.ex: Some films chill you to the marrow of your bones.
example.tran: 有些电影让人毛骨悚然。

entry.def: If something sends a chill through you, it gives you a sudden feeling of fear or anxiety.

example.ex: The violence used against the students sent a chill through Indonesia...
example.tran: 针对学生的暴力使得整个印度尼西亚不寒而栗。

example.ex: He smiled, an odd, dreamy smile that sent chills up my back.
example.tran: 他笑了，笑容古怪迷离，叫我后背发凉。

entry.def: A chill is a mild illness which can give you a slight fever and headache.

example.ex: He caught a chill while performing at a rain-soaked open-air venue.
example.tran: 他在大雨瓢泼的露天场地演出时受了寒。

entry.def: Chill weather is cold and unpleasant.

example.tran: 凄风、冷雨和波浪起伏的大海

means.word_mean: 1. coldness due to a cold environment
2. an almost pleasurable sensation of fright;

sentences.sentence: "a frisson of surprise shot through him"

means.word_mean: 3. a sensation of cold that often marks the start of an infection and the development of a fever

sentences.sentence: "The news of the city's surrender chilled the soldiers"
"The air cooled considerably after the thunderstorm"

list.explanation: 不理睬某人，对某人冷淡

example.en: She was pretty snooty till we all put the chill on her.
example.zh: 她可真是高傲自大极了，直弄得我们大家都不理睬她。

example.en: I sent him a real snorter, because he really quite put the chill on me.
example.zh: 我寄给他一封措同极为严厉的信，因为他对我实在太冷淡了。

example.en: Moyer had the chill put on Stein.
example.zh: 莫耶尔雇人杀死了斯坦因。

auth_sentence.content: Transfer to the fridge and chill for one hour.
auth_sentence.res_content: Transfer to the fridge and chill for one hour.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Transfer to the fridge and chill for one hour.

auth_sentence.content: Chill in the fridge while you make the sauce.
auth_sentence.res_content: Chill in the fridge while you make the sauce.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Chill in the fridge while you make the sauce.

auth_sentence.content: Cover with the clingfilm and chill in the fridge.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cover with the clingfilm and chill in the fridge.

chill寒冷→adj.&n.寒冷[的], 扫兴[的] v.使冷,变冷

sentences.en: Put the whisky in the icebox to chill.
sentences.cn: 把威士忌放在冰箱里冰镇。

means.word_mean: 令失望；使沮丧；使扫兴；使消沉

sentences.cn: 这个消息使他感到失望。

jushi.english: I want this wine to chill so I'll leave it in a cold place for an hour.
jushi.chinese: 我要把酒弄凉,所以把它放在冷的地方一个小时。

jushi.english: Put the whisky in the ice box to chill.
jushi.chinese: 把威士忌酒放在冰盒里冰镇。

jushi.english: Our hearts chilled when we heard that our team had lost again.
jushi.chinese: 听到我们队再次败北,我们沮丧极了。
